title: Determining Feynman integrals with only input from linear algebra. (arXiv:2201.11637v3 [hep-ph] UPDATED)
description: We find that all Feynman integrals (FIs), having any number of loops, can be completely determined once linear relations between FIs are provided. Therefore, FIs computation is conceptually changed to a linear algebraic problem. Examples up to 5 loops are given to verify this observation. As a byproduct, we get a powerful method to calculate perturbative corrections in quantum field theory.
dc:creator: Zhi-Feng Liu, Yan-Qing Ma
